metadata.title: CVE-2014-9938 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
contrib/completion/git-prompt.sh in Git before 1.9.3 does not sanitizebranch names in the PS1 variable, allowing a malicious repository to causecode execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9938` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-all - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-arch - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-bzr - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-core - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-cvs - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-daemon-run - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-el - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-email - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-gui - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-man - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-mediawiki - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-svn - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4
gitk - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4
gitweb - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: git package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.4').
